item.title: JSON, Gzip, Snappy and Gob Across the Wire
item.description:
Coming from a background where memory and clock cycles were sparse, binary encodings have always held an appeal. Since then Iâ€™ve been told we have loads of compute power, ample cheap RAM and disk, and when the network is the bottleneck then, well, that is a good problem to have.

Its one of those ages old occasionally heated debates….

(tl;dr almost always use gzipped JSON)
